Event.name: Revolution
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> brings about a radical change in leadership by removing the <fen>Current_leadership</fen> and potentially dismantling the <fen>Current_order</fen>, outside recognized means of doing so (e.g., elections).
<ex>Recent reports indicate that <fex name="age">the local troops</fex> have <t>mutinied</t> <fex name="curl">against their superiors</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The individual or group within a society that overturns the <fen>Current_leadership</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Current_leadership
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The people currently in power, whom the <fen>Agent</fen> attempts to overthrow.
<ex>She fomented <t>revolution</t> <fex name="curl">against the Romans</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Current_order
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The currently-existing system of authority or government.
<ex><t>Toppling</t> <fex name="curo">the capitalist government</fex> was their first goal.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location of the revolution.
<ex>A series of <t>revolutions</t> <fex name="pla">in the eastern part of the continent</fex> made long-distance travel all but impossible.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time when the revolution takes place.
<ex>China's <fex name="tim">20th-century</fex> <t>revolutions</t> have yet to have their full impact on global politics.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The means by which the revolution is carried out.
<ex>The infantry launched an <fex name="mea">armed</fex> <t>mutiny</t> over low pay and poor living conditions.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Agent</fen> defeats and removes the <fen>Current_leadership</fen> or removes the <fen>Current_order</fen>.
<ex>After years of back-and-forth fighting it seems unlikely that they will ever <fex name="deg">decisively</fex> <t>overthrow</t> the current regime.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A description of the <fen>Agent</fen> or revolution not covered by more specific FEs.
<ex>Ten years later, after another jail sentence, he led the Civil Forum movement to victory in Czechoslovakia's <fex name="man">peaceful</fex> <t>revolution</t>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: revolutionary.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person participating in a revolution.
